results.title: Atenolol versus propranolol. A comparison of ocular hypotensive effect of an oral dose.
results.text_hl: In a controlled double-blind cross-over trial in 10 patients comprising six with @<m>DISEASE_Glaucoma_Open_Angle</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005902 @@@open-angle glaucoma@@@, three with @DISEASE_Glaucoma_Angle_Closure @DISEASE_MESH:D015812 @@@closed-angle glaucoma@@@, and one with @DISEASE_Ocular_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D009798 @@@ocular hypertension@@@, a single oral dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (50 mg) was significantly more effective than @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (40 mg) in reducing ocular tension.

citations.NLM: Macdonald MJ, Cullen PM, Phillips CI. Atenolol versus propranolol. A comparison of ocular hypotensive effect of an oral dose. Br J Ophthalmol. 1976 Nov;60(11):789-91. PMID: 12782
citations.BibTeX: @article{12782, title={Atenolol versus propranolol. A comparison of ocular hypotensive effect of an oral dose.}, author={Macdonald MJ and Cullen PM and Phillips CI}, journal={Br J Ophthalmol}, volume={60}, number={11}, pages={789-91}}

results.title: Atenolol eye drops in glaucoma: a double-masked, controlled study.
results.text_hl: ...Guttae @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 4% (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Tenormin@@@), a pure beta1-blocking (i.e., cardioselective) drug, produced a median overall fall of 5-6 mmHg (range 3-2 to 13-2 mmHg) in the first tonometrised eyes of 7 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Glaucoma_Open_Angle</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005902 @@@open-angle glaucoma@@@ or @DISEASE_Ocular_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D009798 @@@ocular hypertension@@@ and 1 with @DISEASE_Glaucoma_Angle_Closure @DISEASE_MESH:D015812 @@@closed-angle glaucoma@@@ (off any treatment for the whole of the day preceding each test day) after allowance for an 'effect' of guttae saline 0-9%, in a double-masked, cross-over trial.

citations.NLM: Phillips CI, Gore SM, Macdonald MJ, Cullen PM. Atenolol eye drops in glaucoma: a double-masked, controlled study. Br J Ophthalmol. 1977 May;61(5):349-53. PMID: 326303
citations.BibTeX: @article{326303, title={Atenolol eye drops in glaucoma: a double-masked, controlled study.}, author={Phillips CI and Gore SM and Macdonald MJ and Cullen PM}, journal={Br J Ophthalmol}, volume={61}, number={5}, pages={349-53}}

results.title: Atenolol 4% eye drops and glaucoma. A double-blind short-term clinical trial of a new beta1-adrenergic blocking agent.
results.journal: Albrecht Von Graefes Arch Klin Exp Ophthalmol
results.text_hl: We studied the effect of a single dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 4% eye drops on 21 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Glaucoma_Open_Angle</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005902 @@@primary open-angle glaucoma@@@ during a double-blind clinical trial.

citations.NLM: Ros FE, Dake CL, Offerhaus L, Greve EL. Atenolol 4% eye drops and glaucoma. A double-blind short-term clinical trial of a new beta1-adrenergic blocking agent. Albrecht Von Graefes Arch Klin Exp Ophthalmol. 1977 Dec 31;205(1):61-70. PMID: 341739
